greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest r such that r^k <= spf(n) and gpf(n) < r^(k+1), for some k >= 0, where spf and gpf (smallest and greatest prime factor of n) are given by A020639(n) and A006530(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If A251725(n) = 1, a(n) = 2, otherwise a(n) = A251725(n).
a(n) = a(A066048(n)). [The result depends only on the smallest and the largest prime factor of n.]
program: (define (A252375 n) (let ((spf (A020639 n)) (gpf (A006530 n))) (let outerloop ((r 2)) (let innerloop ((rx 1)) (cond ((and (<= rx spf) (< gpf (* r rx))) r) ((<= rx spf) (innerloop (* r rx))) (else (outerloop (+ 1 r))))))))
(define (A252375 n) (let ((x (A251725 n))) (if (= 1 x) 2 x))) ;; Alternatively, using the implementation of A251725.
xref: Cf. A251726 (those n for which a(n) <= A006530(n)).
Cf. A251727 (those n > 1 for which a(n) = A006530(n)+1).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 17 2014
